website_summaries.verdict: Great price point for a high-end laptop. Extremely lightweight and thin for maximum portability.
pros: Display screen is smaller than most at 12.5 inches, but it offers an amazing 4K resolution
Display also features a wide viewing angle, so people sitting to the side of the laptop can see the screen clearly
Excellent processor to yield strong performance
cons: Some will want a larger display screen
Laptop creates a lot of heat

customer_reviews.title: Regrets
customer_reviews.text: I had this for year or so, also the shortest living laptop I had to replace. The USB has started crapping out. Bluetooth after about 6 months required a full window re image for it to work again and yes, I've tried re downloading Bluetooth driver first. Small excel documents make the screen flicker (stop using for work, shame it seem to be a nice little laptop to carry around) - Contacted support - They gave me list of solution which none worked. Had to read and dig through online forums about solutions which leaded to uninstalled killer internet and razer synapse in order for the laptop to stop freezing. Regrets buying this laptop, may become paper weight pretty soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like it but the fan buzzing noise isn't really something that I can live with. Otherwise it's almost perfect for me. Have to return this. <sigh>
customer_reviews.author: ZenMI

customer_reviews.title: Ordering third battery now...
customer_reviews.text: Battery bulge for the second time. Prevents case from closing fully and impedes trackpad usage. Almost never give negative reviews but two strikes on this one. Very cool machine but battery issue is a non-starter. Update 11/6/2019: Another battery down. Always used Core v2 with fan stand or supplied charger. Also had issues with Killer WiFi/Bluetooth card. Replaced with Intel model and all good on that front. Upgraded SSD. Surprisingly easy to work inside machine but it shouldn't be needed. So wanted to love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sadly cannot recommend, gave me migraines
customer_reviews.text: There are no words on how badly I wanted to love this computer. But despite being able to turn off the Chroma keyboard, it would start up again every time I turned it on and was giving me headaches. It is sadly one of those products that looked so stylish (I know that's not the main reason for getting a computer but eh), and perhaps one of the greatest looking Windows computers I've ever had, but just wasn't practical for me long-term.
customer_reviews.author: coffeescripting

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop but RMA messed up a screw
customer_reviews.text: First one I received had a dead camera and couldn’t boot from USB. Eventually the hard drive stopped being recognized so I had to RMA it. All three issues were resolved but now the bottom screw on the laptop keeps loosening up. Looks like whoever fixed it, messed up the screw. The laptop is great but I have to keep tightening the screw every so often and can’t RMA anymore since it’s now out of warranty.

Don't forget the rainbow light show on the keyboard which is enough to make Mac users turn their heads at the local coffee shop.

On top of that it was rebooting randomly while I was working on stuff so that was kinda annoying. Would recommend to people who like desktop computers because this is basically like one (considering the battery life is about 4-5 Hours).

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations.

customer_reviews.title: Serious heat / cooling issues.
customer_reviews.text: I used this as my primary work and gaming PC, and even on mid-range games like Hearthstone and Magic: the Gathering Arena, it would get uncomfortably hot to the touch after short periods of use, making non-desktop use impractical. After about 18 months, the bottom half had physically warped itself into a curve, leaving the keyboard useless, and shortly afterwards it stopped working completely.

customer_reviews.title: Great size and weight but has its own issues
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is lightweight, looks great, and feels great to use. The 4k display looks great, and the touch screen works super well; however, this laptop has its faults. If you're looking to game at all on this at all you're in the wrong place. Also, the fan randomly sounds like a jet is taking off in the room even when doing basic tasks like watching YouTube or typing a paper. Overall it's alright. Size to capability wise it is the best laptop on the market, but if you don't need a ultra lightweight small laptop I'd recommend looking at a different laptop.

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product - Go with someone who has been in the game longer...
customer_reviews.text: Build quality was great... but fans were extremely loud, to the point of sounding like there was an obstruction in the fan system. Also, the 4k screen was defective. Out of the package, there was a red and blue cloud when viewing a black screen. Amazon has allowed me to refund this and they provided great customer service. Don't bother contacting Razer as they are extremely unhelpful and will make you wait weeks for an answer. I'm returning this for an alienware computer now....

customer_reviews.title: Call me a razerfangay I don't care.
customer_reviews.text: Got a refurbished one and had to do some severe registry cleaning. If I had a spare copy of Windows I would have done a clean install, but I'm also stubborn. It took about two weeks of squashing registry errors and it has been perfect since. Well the windows 10 creators edition update, or whatever the chuck that garbage is called, broke the touch screen so I can't update the OS until I find out if that has ever been resolved. Other than that I love this computer, I would choose it over the life of my first born. It is that good.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Positivity

customer_reviews.title: Battery not detected out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I was *super* excited to get this laptop but it was broken out of the box. I used this laptop for a day plugged in and it worked wonderfully. This is truly an awesome value compared to other laptops. Sadly, however, I realized that the laptop would not turn on if not plugged in. Turns out the battery was defective. This seems to be a somewhat common problem (see Amazon and Microsoft Store reviews.) Sigh. Pros: - Small - Great value - Very pretty Cons: - Battery not detected out of the box - Needed to install Windows 10 (3 hours process) out of the box

Razer Blade Stealth gives you access to 16.8 million color options per key powered by Razer Chroma. This anti-ghosting keyboard registers simultaneous key presses with precision
